title: CollectionRegistry
description: Authoritative registry of every vector store collection used by EndogenAI. Collections follow the brain.<module-name> naming convention. The vector store adapter bootstrap process reads this file to provision all missing collections at startup. Do NOT create ad-hoc collections — add them here first.

collections.name: brain.sensory-input
collections.description: Raw multi-modal perceptual events buffered before downstream processing. Short-lived; TTL-pruned aggressively.
collections.notes: Items here are transient. Access count and TTL fields on MemoryItem are strongly enforced.

collections.name: brain.attention-filtering
collections.description: Salience-scored summaries of sensory events that passed attention gating. Inputs to perception.
collections.notes: Stores intermediate attentional focus records. Cleared each processing cycle unless promoted.

collections.name: brain.perception
collections.description: Integrated perceptual representations after multi-modal fusion. Semantically richer than raw sensory input.
collections.notes: Embeddings encode fused perceptual meaning, not raw bytes.

collections.name: brain.working-memory
collections.description: Current context window — task state, active goals, conversation turns held in immediate focus.
collections.notes: Capacity-constrained. Items compete on importanceScore; lowest importance is evicted first.

collections.name: brain.short-term-memory
collections.description: Recent experiential records spanning the current session. Survives working-memory eviction but is eventually consolidated into long-term.
collections.notes: Consolidation to brain.long-term-memory is triggered by learning-adaptation module.

collections.name: brain.long-term-memory
collections.description: Persistent world model. Semantically indexed facts, learned associations, and consolidated episodic memories.
collections.notes: Primary retrieval source for reasoning. Importance threshold for storage: ≥ 0.5.

collections.name: brain.episodic-memory
collections.description: Autobiographical event records with temporal ordering. Enables experiential recall and counterfactual simulation.
collections.notes: Each item should carry a sessionId and taskId in its sourceRef metadata to enable timeline reconstruction.

collections.name: brain.affective
collections.description: Emotional context and reward signal history. Used to modulate motor-output tone and reinforce learning.
collections.notes: Reward signals from reward-signal.schema.json should be stored here alongside their triggering event ID.

collections.name: brain.reasoning
collections.description: Intermediate and final reasoning traces. Stores chain-of-thought fragments, hypotheses, and conclusions.
collections.notes: High churn. Items are typically short-lived unless flagged as reusable by the reasoning module.

collections.name: brain.executive-agent
collections.description: Task decompositions, sub-task states, and inter-agent delegation records produced by the executive planner.
collections.notes: Stores A2ATask objects and their outcomes as MemoryItems for retrospective planning.

collections.name: brain.agent-runtime
collections.description: Agent execution metadata: tool call logs, action traces, and runtime telemetry.
collections.notes: Do not store PII in this collection. Tool call arguments must be sanitized per validation.md before upsert.

collections.name: brain.motor-output
collections.description: Records of actions taken: API calls, UI events, text outputs, and any effector operations.
collections.notes: Acts as an action log. Enables causal tracing from decision to outcome.

collections.name: brain.learning-adaptation
collections.description: Learning signals and adaptation records: fine-tuning triggers, skill acquisition events, and policy updates.
collections.notes: Items here drive consolidation triggers for other collections. Importance scores here influence retention across the brain.

collections.name: brain.metacognition
collections.description: Self-monitoring records: confidence calibration, error post-mortems, and capability assessments.
collections.notes: Used by the reasoning module to self-regulate. Stores both successes and failure patterns.

collections.name: brain.knowledge
collections.description: Seed knowledge base seeded from resources/static/knowledge/. Read-heavy, write-rarely. Immutable facts about the domain.
collections.notes: Seeded at init from resources/static/knowledge/brain-structure.md and related docs. Items added here should carry version metadata.
